input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to find a hidden unicode maker on your computer?
input_text.Response A:
Sure, I can help with that!  First you need to open a terminal window, which you can do by going to Applications -> Utilities -> Terminal.  In the terminal window, type the following command:
mkroman

This will create a new file called ‘mkroman’ in the directory that you are currently in.  Next, open the ‘mkroman’ file in your preferred text editor, such as TextEdit or Sublime Text.  You’ll see something like the following:

#!/bin/bash

echo -n "This is a Unicode arrow pointing to the upper right: "
echo -n "\u2192"

The first line is a “shebang” line that tells the computer what program to use to run the script.  The second line just prints a string, and the third line is the important one: it prints the unicode character that looks like an arrow pointing to the upper right.  You can replace the character on the third line with any other unicode character you’d like to print.  To save your changes, just close the file in your editor.  To run the script, you can double-click on the file, or type the following in a terminal window:
./mkroman

This will print the string with the unicode character that you specified in the file.  If you’d like to make this accessible from the keyboard, you can create an Automator application that runs the script, or you can create a keyboard shortcut that runs the script.  I hope
input_text.Response B: Sure, if you’re using an operating system like Windows 10, you can find the maker by going to the “My Computer” menu, then right-clicking on the “This PC” item, and then clicking on “Show All Files and Folders”.  This will open up a window that shows all the files and folders on your computer, including the ones that are hidden from you.  You can then click on the “Show Hidden Files and Folders” option in the “Show” menu to show all the hidden files and folders.  After that, you can click on the “Find” button to search for a file or folder that you’re looking for, and then click on the “Create” button to create a new file or folder.  If you’re not using Windows 10, you can search for “hidden files and folders” on your computer’s search engine, or you can go to the “File” menu in your computer’s operating system and click on the “Create” button to create a new file or folder.
